author: Rebecca Salinas
title: Mysterious demon creeping at Texas children's museum resurfaces in time for Halloween
text:
Photo: Reddit Image 1 of / 32 32 This creepy image, originally published by KRAMERisCRUNK on Reddit, has resurfaced every Halloween since it was published two years ago. While some people think the figure in the background is a demon, others think the figure is a distorted human. The photo was taken at the Fort Worth Museum of Science and History. Local authorities allegedly took down the sphere years ago. Photo: Jerald Jackson/ Flickr Image 32 of 32 Mysterious demon creeping at Texas children's museum resurfaces in time for Halloween 1 / 32 Back to Gallery A newly resurfaced, straight-up horrifying photo of a demonic-like figure preying on children at the Fort Worth Museum of Science and History could induce some serious nightmares.
But a spokeswoman from the museum has one thing to say to the public: They ain’t afraid of no ghosts.
That’s because there are no ghosts, grim reapers, demons, monsters or goblins in the museum. Or so they think.
Becky E. Adamietz, the museum’s director of public affairs, said on Thursday that since the photo was first published on Reddit two years ago, no other visitor has claimed they have seen a ghost-like creature lurking around the museum.
RELATED: Photo of ghostlike figure at El Paso High School goes viral
The creepy image, originally published by KRAMERisCRUNK on Reddit , shows a dark silhouette in the corner of a children’s exhibit. The figure seems to be hooded, but its hands and face are distorted.
At least two publications have reported on the photo leading up to Halloween 2015, including the Dallas Observer .
“I guess if you have an active imagination, you could see whatever you want,” Adamietz said. “It’s more of a curiosity than anything else, I guess.”
Still, employees at the museum have had “discussions” about what the figure could be, she said.
Museum staff believe the shadow is a distorted parent or child cleaning up, she said, adding the lens was simply “out of focus” because the figure was standing in a dark corner.
Adamietz said the photo has made its rounds every Halloween, and “maybe every Halloween, it’s going to pop up again.”
Click through the slideshow to view various versions of the image, followed by haunted spots around Texas.
rsalinas@mysa.com
